title: The Great Pierpont Morgan: A Biography
description:
The Great Pierpont Morgan: A Biography - Frederick Lewis Allen [epub]

Celebrated as a titan of industry by some and decried as a monopolizing robber baron by others, John Pierpont Morgan was without a doubt a dominant player in American finance at the turn of the twentieth century. He founded U.S. Steel, a conglomeration of leading steel and iron producers, which was the nationâ€™s largest coast-to-coast railroad system, and the first company to be worth more than $1 billion.
 
Morgan was also instrumental in developing the Federal Reserve after working with political leaders to prevent a potentially devastating fiscal crisis in 1907. Indeed, he was a driving force in the modernization of American business, and the effects of his acumen and foresight continue to resonate todayâ€”on Wall Street and beyond.
 
Additionally, known for his displays of wealth and power, Morgan was a prominent figure of the New York society sceneâ€”a member of the original one percentâ€”as well as a notable art connoisseur with a sizable collection now housed in Manhattanâ€™s lavish Morgan Library & Museum, once his own private library.
 
In this meticulously researched and comprehensive biography, Frederick Lewis Allen, former editor of Harperâ€™s magazine and author of Only Yesterday, delves into the life and character of a fascinating, multidimensional man. Allen also probes the evolution of the business landscape during Morganâ€™s lifetime, when giant corporations with unparalleled economies of scale began to absorb and replace smaller competitors
